snippet: Despite efforts to address concerns, Mayor Bill de Blasio and Police Commissioner William J. Bratton continue to draw criticism over the resignation of Philip Banks III.
abstract: Several black elected officials across New York City suggest that City Hall should exert greater control over Police Dept’s leadership after abrupt resignation of Philip Banks II, department's highest-ranking African-American uniformed officer; Council members appear frustrated with pace of police reform on Mayor Bill de Blasio's watch and Police Commr William J Bratton's handling of resignation.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

lead_paragraph: Despite efforts to address concerns, Mayor Bill de Blasio and Police Commissioner William J. Bratton continue to draw criticism over the resignation of Philip Banks III.

headline.main: Politicians Show Frustration After a Police Chief’s Exit in New York
headline.print_headline: Politicians Show Frustration After a Police Chief’s Exit
